parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Nazareth, a Nazarene. From Nazareth; a Nazarene, i.e. Inhabitant of Nazareth.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
